summary: The 'Break the Cycle of Violence Act' (HR 4103) aims to reduce community violence through community-based intervention strategies. It authorizes the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award grants for programs targeting those at high risk of violence, including community outreach, hospital-based programs, and group violence interventions. The bill also establishes an Office of Community Violence Intervention and a National Community Violence Response Center to provide support and research. Additionally, it includes Department of Labor grants for job training programs for opportunity youth in areas affected by gun violence.
